intro: Psychotria cheathamiana, commonly known as Cheatham's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-white flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
